It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red veins on its heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its ornamental value comes from its vibrant foliage, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.

It is also native to parts of Oceania, including Papua New Guinea and some Pacific islands.
